content: Yes, the fire that broke out at Notre Dame Cathedral in Paris on April 15, 2019, caused significant damage to the historic landmark. The spire of the cathedral collapsed, and much of the roof was destroyed. There was also damage to some of the stone vaulting and many of the cathedral's stained glass windows. However, thanks to the quick response of firefighters and other emergency personnel, much of the structure and many of its valuable artworks and religious relics were spared. In the years since the fire, significant restoration work has been undertaken to repair and rebuild the damaged sections of the cathedral.
